projectOverview.name: LocalNetChat
projectOverview.description: A lightweight desktop/mobile chat application that operates entirely over a local network (LAN). It allows users to exchange text messages, broadcast status updates, and share files without requiring internet connectivity or external servers.
projectOverview.targetAudience: Small teams, classrooms, or any environment where users share a local network.
projectOverview.deploymentModel: Peer‑to‑peer with optional local host discovery service.

userStories.title: User Identification
userStories.description: As a user, I want to choose a unique display name so that others can identify me.
acceptanceCriteria: The app prompts for a username on first launch.
Duplicate usernames are rejected with an error message.

userStories.title: View Online Users
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see a list of all currently online users along with their status.
acceptanceCriteria: The user list updates in real time as peers join/leave.
Each entry shows the user’s display name and status (Online/Offline/Busy/Idle).

userStories.title: Send & Receive Text Messages
userStories.description: As a user, I want to send text messages to individual peers and receive them instantly.
acceptanceCriteria: Messages appear in a chat window with timestamp.
The message is delivered within 200 ms on a typical LAN.

userStories.title: Broadcast Status
userStories.description: As a user, I want to set my status (Online/Busy/Idle) so that others can see my availability.
acceptanceCriteria: Status changes are reflected in the user list immediately.

userStories.title: File Sharing
userStories.description: As a user, I want to send files up to 50 MB to a peer, and receive them with progress feedback.
acceptanceCriteria: The file transfer completes within 5 seconds on a 100 Mbps LAN.
The recipient can cancel the transfer mid‑stream.

userStories.title: Chat History
userStories.description: As a user, I want to view previous messages exchanged with a peer when I open the chat window.
acceptanceCriteria: Messages are persisted locally for 30 days.
History is loaded instantly on opening a conversation.

userStories.title: Cross‑Platform Consistency
userStories.description: As a user, I want the same user experience on all supported platforms.
acceptanceCriteria: UI elements are responsive and use native controls where appropriate.
Feature set is identical across platforms.

functionalRequirements.name: Peer Discovery
functionalRequirements.description: Automatically discover peers on the same subnet using mDNS/UDP broadcast.
details: Broadcast a presence packet every 5 seconds.
Listen for presence packets from other peers.

functionalRequirements.name: Secure Communication
functionalRequirements.description: Encrypt all messages and file transfers using TLS 1.3 over a local socket.
details: Generate a self‑signed certificate on first launch.

functionalRequirements.name: Message Queue
functionalRequirements.description: Queue outgoing messages and retry on transient network failures.
details: Retry up to 3 times with exponential backoff.
Notify the user if a message cannot be delivered after retries.

functionalRequirements.name: File Transfer Protocol
functionalRequirements.description: Implement chunked transfer with checksum verification.

functionalRequirements.name: Status Update Service
functionalRequirements.description: Send periodic status updates to peers.
details: Include idle detection based on user activity.

functionalRequirements.name: Local Persistence
functionalRequirements.description: Store user settings, chat history, and recent file transfer logs locally.

nonFunctionalRequirements.name: Performance
nonFunctionalRequirements.description: All UI interactions must be responsive (<200 ms).
nonFunctionalRequirements.metrics: Message latency <200 ms; file transfer throughput ≥80 % of theoretical LAN speed.

nonFunctionalRequirements.name: Scalability
nonFunctionalRequirements.description: Support up to 50 concurrent peers on a single subnet.
nonFunctionalRequirements.metrics: CPU usage <30 % on a 2 GHz CPU; memory <200 MB.

nonFunctionalRequirements.name: Reliability
nonFunctionalRequirements.description: The application must recover from network interruptions without data loss.
nonFunctionalRequirements.metrics: Automatic reconnection within 5 seconds; no message duplication.

nonFunctionalRequirements.name: Security
nonFunctionalRequirements.description: Ensure confidentiality, integrity, and authenticity of all communications.
nonFunctionalRequirements.metrics: TLS 1.3 used; no plaintext logs; no data sent outside the local network.

nonFunctionalRequirements.name: Usability
nonFunctionalRequirements.description: Interface should be intuitive for non‑technical users.
nonFunctionalRequirements.metrics: First‑time user onboarding <3 minutes; error rate <2 %.

nonFunctionalRequirements.name: Compliance
nonFunctionalRequirements.description: Comply with GDPR for local data handling.
nonFunctionalRequirements.metrics: No personal data stored on external servers.

businessRules.rule: All communications occur exclusively within the local subnet; no external IP or DNS resolution is permitted.
businessRules.explanation: Ensures data privacy and reduces latency.

businessRules.rule: Maximum file size for transfer is 50 MB.
businessRules.explanation: Prevents excessive bandwidth usage on shared networks.

businessRules.rule: Usernames must be unique per subnet.
Message history retention period is 30 days.
businessRules.explanation: Balances storage usage with user expectations.

businessRules.rule: The application must not require administrative privileges to run.

successCriteria.criterion: All user stories are fully implemented and pass automated tests.
Message latency on a 100 Mbps LAN is <200 ms.
successCriteria.target: Measured in a controlled lab test.

successCriteria.criterion: File transfer of 50 MB completes in <5 seconds on a 100 Mbps LAN.
successCriteria.target: Measured in a controlled lab test.

successCriteria.criterion: The application runs on all target platforms without crashes.
successCriteria.target: Automated UI and integration tests pass on Windows, macOS, Linux, Android, iOS.

successCriteria.criterion: Security audit confirms TLS 1.3 usage and no plaintext data leakage.
